articles.description: From the president to Jared Kushner to Hope Hicks, the Trump administration kept the internet on its toes last week.
articles.title: This Week's Internet News: Social Media Can't Keep Up With the White House
articles.author: Graeme McMillan

articles.description: As YouTube continues in its efforts to crack down harder on content that violates its terms of usage and promotes offensive and/or misleading content, it’s found itself in the fake news crossfire this weekend. After a video and some advertisers were removed f…
articles.title: YouTube removes ads from InfoWars’ Alex Jones channel but says it has no plans to delete it
articles.author: Ingrid Lunden

articles.description: For many in the open source community, code and technology are meant to be free, shared with all of humanity in the pursuit of a better present and future. That is not how governments see it though. In their minds, technology is a strategic asset that provide…
articles.title: WTF is CFIUS?
articles.author: Danny Crichton

articles.description: President Trump made his first foray into the Washington social scene by attending the 133rd annual Gridiron Club Dinner with a group of journalists.
articles.title: A Night of Laughs Between Trump and His Favorite Punching Bag
articles.author: MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MICHAEL TACKETT

articles.description: A tour of the Gateway tunnel project near 31st Street in Manhattan, between 10th and 11th Avenues. President Trump has withdrawn his support for the project, widely viewed as a critical solution for the region’s transportation needs.
articles.title: Trump’s Yanked Support for Hudson Tunnel Angers Those Who Saw a Done Deal
articles.author: PATRICK McGEEHAN and JEFFERY C. MAYS

articles.description: Here’s what you need to know about the week’s top stories.
articles.title: Tariffs, N.R.A., Oscars: Your Weekend Briefing
articles.author: KAREN ZRAICK and LANCE BOOTH

articles.description: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
articles.title: Asia and Australia Edition: Your Monday Briefing: China, North Korea, Roger Bannister
articles.author: PENN BULLOCK and CHARLES McDERMID

articles.description: Last week, White House communications director and longtime Donald Trump aide Hope Hicks called it quits. And yes, Saturday Night Live Weekend Update took note. There are some all-star one-liners in this particular Weekend Update — "You know things are bad wh…
articles.title: Trump BFF Hope Hicks pays a visit to 'Saturday Night Live' Weekend Update
articles.author: Adam Rosenberg

articles.description: Melania Trump at the White House last month. Reports that Mrs. Trump received a visa reserved for “individuals with extraordinary ability” in 2001, when she was a model, raised questions about whether she truly qualified.
articles.title: Did Melania Trump Merit an ‘Einstein Visa’? Probably, Immigration Lawyers Say
articles.author: MIRIAM JORDAN

articles.description: The special counsel has asked about the role of the adviser, George Nader, in White House policymaking, indicating that he is examining Emirati influence on the Trump administration.
articles.title: Mueller’s Focus on Adviser to United Arab Emirates Indicates Widening of Inquiry
articles.author: MARK MAZZETTI, DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAGGIE HABERMAN

articles.description: Representative Daniel Lipinski, a conservative-leaning Democrat and a scion of Chicago’s political machine. The battle to define the party is playing out most vividly in overwhelmingly safe House districts around cities like his.
articles.title: As Primaries Begin, Divided Voters Weigh What It Means to Be a Democrat
articles.author: JONATHAN MARTIN and ALEXANDER BURNS

articles.description: Take a look at the week in politics from February 25 through March 3.
articles.title: 1 Trump official resigns; 1 says God punished him
articles.author: Deena Zaru, CNN

articles.description: Former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice praised current Secretary of State Rex Tillerson in an interview that aired Sunday on CNN, saying it is "exceedingly difficult" to do his job when he doesn't know when President Donald Trump will tweet policy.
articles.title: Rice: Tillerson's job can be 'exceedingly difficult'
articles.author: Aileen Graef, CNN

articles.description: Jon Romano, who took a shotgun into school in 2004, praised student activists and gun control calls.
articles.title: Jailed school shooter praises Florida student activists
articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/bbcnews

articles.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump has spoken to world leaders about his planned tariff hike on steel and aluminum and is not considering any exemptions to the measure, Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Sunday.
articles.title: Trump has spoken with world leaders, no tariff exemptions: Ross to ABC
articles.author: Reuters Editorial

articles.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - In the midst of a joke-filled monologue at a dinner with journalists, President Donald Trump suggested on Saturday that the United States will be meeting with North Korea but has told Pyongyang it must first "denuke."
articles.title: At joke-filled dinner, Trump suggests U.S. will meet with North Korea
articles.author: Makini Brice

articles.description: SYDNEY (Reuters) - The dollar stayed on a slippery slope on Monday amid fears of a global trade war, while the euro dipped briefly but rebounded quickly after results of exit polls for Italy's elections pointed to a hung parliament.
articles.title: Dollar slips on trade war fears, euro bounces after Italian exit polls
articles.author: Swati Pandey

articles.description: BEIJING (Reuters) - China does not want a trade war with the United States, Zhang Yesui, a spokesman for the Chinese parliament, said on Sunday at a briefing ahead of China's annual session of parliament, which begins this week.
articles.title: China says it does not want a trade war with U.S
articles.author: Reuters Editorial

articles.description: HONG KONG/HANOI (Reuters) - The visit of a U.S. aircraft carrier to Vietnam for the first time since the end of the Vietnam War is a powerful symbol of the growing strategic ties between the former foes.
articles.title: Vietnam seeks to pacify China as landmark U.S. carrier visit signals warming ties
articles.author: Greg Torode

articles.description: Theresa May has called Trump to raise Britain’s ‘deep concern’ over US plans to impose tariffs on imports of steel and aluminium
articles.title: Ben Jennings on Donald Trump's trade policy – cartoon
articles.author: Ben Jennings
